name: set_air_cooled_air_conditioner_cop
display_name: Set Air Cooled Air Conditioner COP

arguments.name: input_option_manual
arguments.display_name: Option 1, set rated COP to a user defined value

arguments.name: input_option_standard
arguments.display_name: Option 2, set rated COP based on ASHRAE Standard 90 requirement

arguments.name: total_cooling_capacity
arguments.units: Only used to lookup 90.1 requirements, not used to change model capacity

modeler_description_xml: The measure loops through the baseline model and identifies the OS:Coil:Cooling:DX:SingleSpeed and OS:Coil:Cooling:DX:TwoSpeed objects. The measure is applicable to the cooling coils only if the coil is part of an air loop that contains an OS:Coil:Heating:Electric, OS:Coil:Heating:Gas, OS:Coil:Heating:Water, or no heating coil object. Users can choose one or all cooling coils from the drop down list to change their rated COP settings. Then users need to select Option 1 or 2 using the check box. For Option 1, a rated COP input is required and it is applied to the selected cooling coils. For Option 2, users need to specify the rated total cooling capacity and the version of Standard 90.1. These inputs are used to identify the COP requirement in the Standard 90.1, which is used to change the model. The initial and final values of the COP are reported during simulation.
description_xml: Air conditioner coefficient of performance (COP) affects cooling  energy consumption. The measure offers two options to set the air-cooled air conditioner COP. Option 1 allows users to specify the COP input directly. Option 2 determines the COP based on the rated total cooling capacity and the prescriptive requirements in ASHRAE Standard 90.1.
